                    ### Question
                    Aminoglycoside affects ?

                    ### Options
                    opa. Outer hair cells in basal area
opb. Inner hair cells in basal area
opc. Outer hair cells in apical area
opd. Inner hair cells in apical area

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Aminoglycosides are known to cause ototoxicity, primarily affecting the cochlear hair cells. The consensus in medical literature indicates that aminoglycosides predominantly damage the outer hair cells, particularly in the basal area of the cochlea. This is because the basal area is more sensitive to the effects of these drugs, leading to high-frequency hearing loss. The retrieved evidence paths support the interaction of ototoxicity with hair cells, confirming the focus on outer hair cells. Inner hair cells are less commonly affected, and damage to the apical area is not typically associated with aminoglycoside ototoxicity. Therefore, the most accurate option is that aminoglycosides affect the outer hair cells in the basal area.
